comment:
* Maintains state information for a single trackball axis, generating
     * discrete (DPAD) movements based on raw trackball motion.

variables.name: MAX_ACCELERATION
variables.comment: * The maximum amount of acceleration we will apply.

variables.name: FAST_MOVE_TIME
variables.comment:
* The maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) between events in order
         * for us to consider the user to be doing fast trackball movements,
         * and thus apply an acceleration.

variables.name: ACCEL_MOVE_SCALING_FACTOR
variables.comment:
* Scaling factor to the time (in milliseconds) between events to how
         * much to multiple/divide the current acceleration.  When movement
         * is < FAST_MOVE_TIME this multiplies the acceleration; when >
         * FAST_MOVE_TIME it divides it.

methods.name: float collect(float off, long time, String axis)
methods.comment:
* Add trackball movement into the state.  If the direction of movement
         * has been reversed, the state is reset before adding the
         * movement (so that you don't have to compensate for any previously
         * collected movement before see the result of the movement in the
         * new direction).
         *
         * @return Returns the absolute value of the amount of movement
         * collected so far.

methods.name: int generate()
methods.comment:
* Generate the number of discrete movement events appropriate for
         * the currently collected trackball movement.
         *
         * @return Returns the number of discrete movements, either positive
         * or negative, or 0 if there is not enough trackball movement yet
         * for a discrete movement.

methodNames: float collect(float off, long time, String axis)
